register.name: IPSBAR
register.description: Peripheral System Base Address Register\n The IPSBAR specifies the base address for the 1-Gbyte memory space associated with the on-chip peripherals.\n At reset, the base address is loaded with 0x4000_0000 and marked as valid (IPSBAR[V]=1)

field.name: V
field.description: Valid\nEnables the IPS Base address region. V is set at reset

field.name: BA
field.description: Base address\n Defines the base address of the 1-Gbyte internal peripheral space\n This is the starting address for the IPS registers when the valid bit is set

register.name: RAMBAR
register.description: Memory Base Address Register\n Controls peripheral (e.g., DMA and FEC) access to the SRAM

field.name: BDE
field.description: Back door enable\n Qualifies non-core master module accesses to the memory

field.name: BA
field.description: Base address\n Defines the memory module's base address on a 64-Kbyte boundary corresponding to the physical array location within the 4 Gbyte address space supported by ColdFire

register.name: PPMRH
register.description: Peripheral Power Management\n The PPMRH and PPMRL registers control the generation of the module clocks for peripherals

register.name: CRSR
register.description: Core Reset Status Register\n The CRSR contains a bit that indicates the reset source to the CPU

field.name: EXT
field.description:
External reset
 An external device driving RSTI caused the last reset.
 Assertion of reset by an external device causes the processor core to initiate reset exception processing.
 All registers are forced to their initial state

register.name: CWCR
register.description: Core Watchdog Control Register\n The core watchdog timer prevents system lockup if the software becomes trapped in a loop with no controlled exit.\n If enabled, the watchdog timer requires the periodic execution of a core watchdog servicing sequence

field.name: CWTIF
field.description: Timer interrupt flag\n Write a 1 to clear the interrupt request

field.name: CWTAVAL
field.description: Transfer acknowledge valid\n Write a 1 to clear this flag bit

field.name: CWTA
field.description: Transfer acknowledge enable\n After one CWT time-out period of the unacknowledged assertion of the CWT interrupt, the transfer acknowledge asserts.\n This allows the CWT to terminate a bus cycle and interrupt acknowledge to occur

field.name: CWT
field.description: Watchdog timing delay\n These bits select the timeout period for the CWT

field.name: CWRI
field.description: Watchdog interrupt select\n If a time-out occurs, the CWT generates an interrupt to the processor core\n If a core reset is required, the watchdog interrupt should set the soft reset bit in the Reset Control register

register.name: CWSR
register.description: Watchdog Service Register\n Used to provide the software watchdog service sequence to prevent a CWT time-out.\n The service sequence requires two writes to this register: 0x55 followed by 0xAA

register.name: DMAREQC
register.description: DMA Request Control\n The DMAREQC register provides a software-controlled connection matrix for DMA requests.\n It logically routes DMA requests from the DMA timers and UARTs to the four channels of the DMA controller

register.name: PPMRL
register.description: Peripheral Power Management\n The PPMRH and PPMRL registers control the generation of the module clocks for peripherals

register.name: MPARK
register.description:
Bus Master Park Register
 The MPARK controls the operation of the system bus arbitration module.
 The initial state of the master priorities is M3 > M2 > M1 > M0
 The M1_PRTY field should not be set for a priority higher than third

field.name: LCKOUT_TIME
field.description: Lock-out Time\n Lock-out time for a master being denied the bus. The lock out time is defined as 2^ LCKOUT_TIME

field.name: PRKLAST
field.description: Parking Master\nPark on the last active master or highest priority master if no masters are active

field.name: TIMEOUT
field.description: Timeout Enable\nMonitors masters being locked out of the bus

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled\t- Allow a master access when it has been locked out for LCKOUT_TIME

field.name: BCR24BIT
field.description: Size of DMA BCRs\nEnables the use of 24 bit byte count registers in the DMA module

field.name: M2_P_EN
field.description: DMA bandwidth control enable\n Allows the use of the DMA's bandwidth control to elevate the priority of its bus requests

register.name: MPR
register.description: Controls the bus master privilege level\nDefines the access privilege level of each bus master

register.name: PPMRS
register.description: Peripheral Power Management Set Register\n Provides a memory-mapped mechanism to set a given bit in the PPMRx registers to disable the clock for a IPS module.\n The data value on a register write causes the corresponding bit in the PPMRx register to be set. The SMCD bit provides a global set function, forcing the entire contents of the PPMRx to be set, disabling all IPS module clocks. Reads of this register return all zeroes

field.name: SMCD
field.description: Set module clock disable\n Selects the corresponding bit in PPMRx, disabling the peripheral clock

field.name: SAMCD
field.description: Set all module clock disables\n Allows a single bit or all bits in the PMMRx to be set

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Selected bit\t- Set only those bits specified in the SMCD field

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All bits\t- Set all bits in PPMRH and PPMRL, disabling all peripheral clocks

register.name: PPMRC
register.description: Peripheral Power Management Clear Register\n Provides a memory-mapped mechanism to clear a given bit in the PPMRx registers to enable the clock for a IPS module.\n The data value on a register write causes the corresponding bit in the PPMRx register to be clear. The SMCD bit provides a global clear function, forcing the entire contents of the PPMRx to be cleared, enabling all IPS module clocks. Reads of this register return all zeroes

field.name: SMCD
field.description: Clear module clock disable\n Selects the corresponding bit in PPMRx, enabling the peripheral clock

field.name: SAMCD
field.description: Clear all module clock disables\n Allows a single bit or all bits in the PMMRx to be cleared

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0
enumeratedValue.description: Selected bit\t- Clear only those bits specified in the SMCD field

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1
enumeratedValue.description: All bits\t- Clear all bits in PPMRH and PPMRL, enabling all peripheral clocks

register.name: IPSBMT
register.description: IPS Bus Timeout Monitor\n The IPS controller implements a bus timeout monitor to ensure that every IPS bus cycle is properly terminated within a programmed period of time

field.name: BMT
field.description: Bus monitor timeout\n This field selects the timeout period (measured in system bus clock cycles) for the bus monitor

register.name: PACR%s
register.description:
Peripheral Access Control Register %s
 Access to several on-chip peripherals is controlled by shared peripheral access control register.
 A single PACR defines the access level for each of the two modules:
 PACR0 	SCM 		--------
 PACR1 	-------- 	DMA
 PACR2 	UART0 	UART1
 PACR3 	UART2 	--------
 PACR4 	I2C0 		QSPI
 PACR5 	I2C1 		--------
 PACR6 	DTIM0 	DTIM1
 PACR7 	DTIM2 	DTIM3
 PACR8 	INTC0 	--------
 PACR10 	FEC 			--------

field.name: ACCESS_CTRL0
field.description: Supervisor,User access control\n This 3-bit field defines the access control for the given platform peripheral

field.name: LOCK0
field.description: ACCESSCTRLx Lock\n This bit, when set, prevents subsequent writes to ACCESSCTRLx. Any attempted write to the PACR generates an error termination and the contents of the register are not affected. Only a system reset clears this flag

register.name: GPACR%s
register.description: Grouped Peripheral Access Control\n The on-chip peripheral space starting at IPSBAR is subdivided into 16 64-Mbyte regions.\n The first two regions have unique access control registers associated with it

field.name: ACCESS_CTRL
field.description: Supervisor,User access control\n This 4-bit field defines the access control for the given memory region

field.name: LOCK
field.description:
Lock bit
 When set, this bit prevents writes to the GPACR.
 Any attempted write to the GPACR generates an error termination and the contents of the register are not affected.
 Only a system reset clears this flag
